thread.title: Bradenton car dealership has 9 DeLorean's for sale
thread.title_full: Bradenton car dealership has 9 DeLorean's for sale

title: Bradenton car dealership has 9 DeLorean's for sale
text:
Bradenton car dealership has 9 DeLorean's for sale 10 News Staff, WTSP 10:28 a.m. EDT October 21, 2015 DeLoreans for sale 
Today is the day the Internet has been buzzing about, Wednesday, October 21st, 2015, the exact day that characters Doc Brown and Marty McFly traveled to in “Back to the Future II” in the now iconic DeLorean DMC-12. 
If you're a die-hard fan and always dreamed of owning a DeLorean, it might surprise you to know that it’s actually not as impossible as one would think. In fact. Autotrader.com has 9 of them listed at Gulf Coast Motorworks in Bradenton, Florida. 
Wednesday (October 21st), the dealership will have them all displayed in the showroom to commemorate the occasion. 
PHOTOS: DeLorean sports cars remain popular The DeLorean sports car was only made for a brief time in the early 1980s, but it lives on through TV and film. Here, Matt Hissem poses with his 1981 DeLorean near Mensha, Wis., Hissem has converted the iconic car into a detailed replica of the time machine from the "Back to the Future" movies. William Glasheen, AP Matt Hissem sits in his 1981 DeLorean near Mensha, Wis., Hissem has converted the iconic car into a detailed replica of the time machine from the "Back to the Future" movies. William Glasheen, AP Wayne Gillard polishes up his 1981 DeLorean DMC 12, one of only six in Australia and up for auction, in 2004 WILLIAM WEST, AFP/Getty Images Former General Motors executive John Z. DeLorean, poses in front of a poster of the stylistic sports car he created in a 1982 file photo Associated Press View of the Delorean DMC 12, the famous car in the trilogy "Back to the Future", is pictured at Le Bourget airport, near Paris on June 19, 2013 during the 50th International Paris Air show. ERIC FEFERBERG, AFP/Getty Images Aldo Buono, of Philadelphia, secretary of the 76-member DeLorean club, poses near his 1981 DeLorean in Philadelphia, in this undated photo ANDREA MIHALIK, Associated Press A DeLorean showed up in the Fox TV series "Raising Hope" Greg Gayne, FOX Fullscreen In this Oct. 26, 2010 file photo, cast members of the "Back to the Future" movies appear on the NBC "Today" television program, commemorating the 25th anniversary of the films, in New York. They are, from left, posing with a replica of the DeLorean car, Lea Thompson, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen, Michael J. Fox, director Robert Zemeckis , and Huey Lewis. Richard Drew, AP Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
